bioghist.p: Edward Bradford Davis (b. 1921) received his B.D. from Yale Divinity School in 1945 and his Master's and Doctorate from Princeton Seminary 1950 and 1961. He was pastor of churches in New Boston, New Hampshire, and Holmes, Pennsylvania, before becoming pastor of the Presbyterian Church in Absecon, New Jersey from 1959 to 1966. He also served as pastor of the First Presbyterian Church, Darby, Pennsylvania, starting in 1967. Rev. Davis served as senior pastor of the Kensington United Presbyterian Larger Parish, the four-church complex in Kensington, which was the first urban larger parish organized.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes newsletters (The Lamplighter); bulletins for regular and special services; reports including annual reports, treasurer's reports, and reports of senior pastors; minutes of congregational meetings; memoranda; clippings; correspondence (some to the Presbytery of Philadelphia); and meeting minutes related to the founding of the Kensington Larger Parish. There is also one photograph of Davis and the pastors of Twelfth United Presbyterian, Fairhill United Presbyterian, Beacon United Presbyterian and Wilkey Memorial United Presbyterian.
